title: SafeNutriKids dietary attributes reference
description: Optional reference list of dietary patterns and constraints aligned with Open Food Facts 'These diets' and related documentation.

items.description_en: Diet that excludes meat, fish, and poultry.
items.rule_set_notes: Core parent category for vegetarian variants. FOOD rules only, not an identity label - rules maintained by EVU/V-Label.

items.description_en: Mostly vegetarian diet that includes fish and seafood but excludes other meat.
items.rule_set_notes: Common public-health category but no single certifying body. Best treated as a soft preference rather than a strict rule set.
items.open_food_facts_source: General nutrition literature; discussed alongside vegetarian/vegan patterns in Open Food Facts community resources.

items.description_en: Mostly plant-based diet that occasionally includes meat or fish.
items.rule_set_notes: Described in public health and sustainability literature rather than in formal labelling rules. Represents a gradual shift towards plant-forward eating.
items.open_food_facts_source: General nutrition and sustainability literature; occasionally referenced in Open Food Facts community discussions.

items.description_en: Vegetarian diet that allows eggs but not meat or fish.
items.rule_set_notes: Clear inclusion of eggs while excluding meat and fish - variant of vegetarianism useful where egg consumption is explicitly allowed.

items.description_en: Vegetarian diet that allows dairy products but not meat or fish.
items.rule_set_notes: Clear inclusion of dairy while excluding meat and fish - common in several regions; useful for labelling and personalisation.

items.description_en: Vegetarian diet that allows eggs and dairy products but not meat or fish.
items.rule_set_notes: Standard vegetarian label for products containing egg and/or dairy but no meat or fish.

items.description_en: Vegetarian diet that also avoids certain 'fetid' or pungent vegetables (e.g. garlic, onions)
items.rule_set_notes: Implemented purely via ingredient groups; cultural and doctrinal variations exist - common vegetarian variant in Europe and India

items.description_en: Strict vegetarian diet excluding root vegetables such as onions, garlic, potatoes and some tubers.
items.rule_set_notes: Excluding meat, alcohol, honey, butter, funghi, root vegetables or spinach as well as fish and dairy. Modelled purely as food rules not as a religious identity.

items.description_en: Diet that excludes all animal products, including meat, fish, dairy, eggs, honey, and gelatine.
items.rule_set_notes: Widely standardised vegan rules via V-Label and similar schemes.

items.description_en: Vegan diet where foods are eaten raw or only very gently heated.
items.rule_set_notes: Combines vegan ingredient rules with a raw-food preparation constraint

items.description_en: Diet based mainly or exclusively on fruits, sometimes with nuts and seeds.
items.rule_set_notes: Highly restrictive; defined largely by inclusion of fruit, nuts, and seeds and exclusion of most other food groups.

items.description_en: Traditional plant-forward pattern emphasising fresh, minimally processed foods and some dairy.
items.rule_set_notes: Rules come from traditional texts and focus on food qualities and freshness.

items.description_en: Diet focusing on whole grains, local vegetables and low-processed foods, often limiting animal products.
items.rule_set_notes: Described in public sources but with some variation between schools - best treated as a general pattern

items.description_en: Diet similar to vegetarianism but allowing kangaroo meat as the only meat exception.
items.rule_set_notes: Culturally specific and mostly illustrative; interesting example of selective meat inclusion.

items.description_en: No specific dietary restriction; may eat meat, fish and animal products.
items.rule_set_notes: Useful as a default when no dietary constraints are set.

items.description_en: Diet that excludes foods heated above a certain temperature (often around 48Â°C).
items.rule_set_notes: Focused on preparation temperature rather than the ingredient list; not easily machine-detectable from labels.

items.description_en: Avoids gluten-containing cereals and derived ingredients.
items.rule_set_notes: Open Food Facts tracks gluten and allergens; this category should be used carefully and is not medical advice.

items.description_en: Avoids lactose; may or may not allow other dairy components depending on context.
items.rule_set_notes: Open Food Facts allergen and lactose-related tags; national dietary guidance.
